title: An Undying Oath

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: Raydrik proved to be even more useless than I thought... Well, if you want something done right, best do it yourself.

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Veld... Explain yourself!

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: Archbishop Manfroy! Wh-When did you get here, Your Eminence?

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Spare me your sniveling formalities. Why is killing one person—a child, need I remind you—so difficult for you? The Leonster heir has humiliated you at every turn!

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: I'm deeply sorry, Your Eminence. I'll claim Prince Leif's head before the day is over, I assure you.

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: See that you do—otherwise, it will be your head that hangs from the castle gates. More than just this battle is riding on the boy's death... If he lives, all our efforts to incite war in Thracia and assassinate Prince Quan will be for nothing.

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: I'm amazed the ruse has held for this long, frankly. The fools still think Travant was behind it all.

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Eheheheh! I almost pity the Thracians, in the depths of their ignorance... Did it never occur to them that Travant had no way of knowing when Quan's forces would march, or what route they would take? Capitalizing on Travant's ambitions to make North and South Thracia tear each other apart... Everything happened exactly as you predicted it would.

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: I'm honored by your words, Your Eminence...

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: But it's simply given way to a new problem: you underestimated the Leonster heir, did you not? It would have been best to nip him in the bud and kill him when Castle Leonster first fell, when he was little more than an infant...

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: It is true that Prince Leif has brought all the rebellious children of North Thracia together in one, organized revolt... But if we strike them down now, when they all act as one and their morale is at its highest, their spirits will be broken. And in my defense, the boy has done us a great service by defeating so many of House Friege's battalions. Without realizing it, he's eliminated one of the few military powers that could've threatened our rule. Besides, while he may be Leonster's heir, he's a mere child without enough holy blood to so much as lift the Gáe Bolg himself. He's a posturing rebel who's deluded himself into thinking he's a real prince. He cannot hope to triumph against me.

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Hmm... You make a good case for yourself, Veld. Very well. I shall grant you a second chance—and as a token of my favor, I bestow upon you five of my finest creations, the Deadlords.

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: I'm most grateful, Your Eminence. Combined with the one I just finished crafting, that makes for a total of six... Now the barrier will be impenetrable!

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Then I'll leave you to it, Veld. I trust you'll be along shortly to bring me the good news...

intro.speaker: Veld
intro.line: I won't fail you, Your Eminence.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Is everyone ready, August?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: All of our troops understand the plan: small squads have each been stationed in front of every altar. Let us hope they're all capable of defeating the horrors that lurk within...

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I know they are. Everyone is aware of what's at stake: the seals inside each of the six altars have to be broken to open the way to Veld.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: It's more complicated than that, my prince. One of our men must stand upon the center of an altar to break its seal. Each of the six altars must have one of our soldiers standing on its center all at once for the barrier to be dispelled. Hrm... I fear reinforcements will arrive if we take too long to coordinate this. You need to prepare yourself to sacrifice some of our troops if it means getting rid of the barrier more quickly.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I understand... But let's hope that won't be necessary. Come on! Let's end this!

battle.speaker: Veld
battle.line: Ah! What?! It can't be... Have those children broken through the seal?! Ngh... Leif, you heathen... You're an impudent brat standing in the way of the divine! I'll send you to oblivion to meet your parents—but not before you spend a century or two decorating my altar as a petrified statue!

boss.speaker: Veld
boss.line: Heh, heh, heh... You dare to cross me? Don't you know the power I wield? Let me show you just what a grave mistake you've made!

boss.speaker: Veld
boss.line: Gah... This is my... own folly... But... this isn't the end...! Even if you kill me, Loptous is eternal... and the rebirth of his empire is nigh! I may die here... but you'll struggle and flounder for the rest of your days...! Heh, heh, heh... Eheheheheheh...!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: We... won...? Is it... really over?

end.speaker: August
end.line: It is. Breathe easy, my prince—your long fight has at last come to an end. With your victory today, the Loptians' influence in North Thracia has been eradicated. At long last, the Thracian people have been liberated from the tyranny of Loptous and his mortal servants. This is all because of your perseverance and strength, my prince. You never gave up.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: No, August... The people have you to thank as well. Without your guidance, I never would've made it this far. I started this journey knowing nothing, and you taught me how to be a ruler. I thank you, August—as a monarch, and as your student. I was truly fortunate to have met you...

end.speaker: August
end.line: This is... I... I'm not sure what to say... I need to tell you something, my prince. I would be a poor teacher if I continued to keep secrets from you now... It was not by chance that our lives intersected. In fact, I only became your tactician because I was ordered to do so by my benefactor. Truth be told, at the outset I thought liberating North Thracia was an impossible task. But as I spent more time by your side, as I saw how focused you were on freeing your motherland, how earnestly you wanted it... Before I knew it, I had genuinely begun to believe in you. I hope you can forgive me for all the times I doubted you.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: I'll not lie, August... The times when you voiced skepticism of my abilities did always weigh heavily on my heart. Yet you also taught me how to expand my perspective: to realize the depth of everyone's suffering and sorrow. My upbringing, strange and sheltered as it was, left me lacking the tools to understand the lives of my subjects. And I think I still have even more to learn... I need you, August. I'd be honored if you stayed by my side and continued to teach me.

end.speaker: August
end.line: Ah... As you wish it, my prince, so shall it be.

end.speaker: Finn
end.line: Lord Leif! A messenger just arrived from Lord Seliph! Conote has been seized by his army!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Huh? Conote has already fallen?! What of Lord Seliph...?

end.speaker: Finn
end.line: He's alive and well, milord—fear not. The message said that he rides for Munster as we speak to help us capture the city. I imagine word has not yet reached him of our victory. He should be in for a most welcome surprise when he arrives.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: I can hardly believe it... For Lord Seliph to conquer such a formidable fortress as Castle Conote in a single day... My only regret is that I couldn't kill King Bloom with my own hands.

end.speaker: Finn
end.line: I sympathize, milord—but as regrets go, you could have ended today with far worse. Remember, North Thracia is now free again. In the streets of Munster, everyone, young and old, celebrates the victory of the Liberation Army. The people cheer your name—they shout that Thracia has been liberated by the son of the late hero Quan.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Finn... We've been through so many long and painful days, haven't we? But however hard I had it, you had it so much worse... You possess more patience and endurance than anyone I've ever known. You've been there for me my whole life. Whenever I felt overwhelmed, I knew I could always rely on you, Finn. You sacrificed everything to raise me. It's like I spent my whole childhood sitting on your lap... How can I ever repay you?

end.speaker: Finn
end.line: L-Lord Leif... Of the four kingdoms of North Thracia—Leonster, Ulster, Conote, and Munster—none save Leonster have a surviving male heir. Hence, the people want to be united under your rule. No others remain who could take the throne. Lord Leif... Please, fulfill their hopes. Be the answer to their prayers. The tragedy of Thracia is that these small kingdoms have been doomed to repeat their petty civil wars, time and time again. Unify Thracia and build a single, prosperous kingdom, as the land once was in the days of Dáinn and Njörun. Doing so was the dream of your late father, Lord Quan—and if you truly wish to repay me, milord, it is what I would ask of you as well.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: I would move the heavens themselves for you, Finn. Of course I'll do as you ask! I've come this far—I won't start running now. I have a duty to protect North Thracia. Unifying all of Thracia will depend on the will of King Travant, but I'll do everything in my power to make it happen. I know that's not ideal, but... Would that be enough to repay you, Finn?

end.speaker: Finn
end.line: It's... all I could have dreamed of, Lord Leif.

end.speaker: Eyvel
end.line: Guess that's the end of this whole mess... Hard to believe this all started with Raydrik kidnapping Little Nan and Mareeta, huh? Ah, Little Lord... It breaks my heart to do this, but me and some of the others have got to head back to Fiana.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: What?! You're not coming with me, Eyvel?! Why would you do that?

end.speaker: Eyvel
end.line: We may have kicked the Loptians out, but there's still lots of pirates around. I can't just leave Fiana and Iz to fend for themselves. Besides, how useful do you think we'd be? You've got a whole army of knights and mages and priests now—you don't need us.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: But... Eyvel...

end.speaker: Eyvel
end.line: Little Lord, I'll be looking forward to the day when you beat the Empire for good and come back to Leonster. When that day comes—not if, but WHEN—I'll bring everybody to Leonster to celebrate.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: ...I'd like that. All right, Eyvel, it's a deal: I promise I'll come back, and you promise to have everyone ready to celebrate. But you might be waiting for a while, so please be patient with me...

end.speaker: Eyvel
end.line: I don't think we'll be waiting for long, actually. I believe in you, Little Leif. Go show the Empire what it's like to have you for an enemy!

end.speaker: Miranda
end.line: Prince Leif, something's been on my mind for a little while.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Princess Miranda? What's wrong?

end.speaker: Miranda
end.line: I... I owe you an apology.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: If this is about Dryas, what happened was my fault. You're not to blame for it, Princess Miranda. And if you haven't heard, Ulster was liberated by Lord Seliph's army. I'm sure your people will be glad to know you're alive and well.

end.speaker: Miranda
end.line: Uh, that's... that's delightful to hear, but... Frankly, my people want more than just to see me again. They want to unify with Leonster. My senior vassals and statesmen are all advising that I wed you. They've been nagging me about it for quite some time, actually. Those bloviating imbeciles think they can boss me around just because I'm a woman...

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Well, out of the royal families of North Thracia's four kingdoms, you and I are the only survivors. They can't be the only people thinking this way. But even so, I still...

end.speaker: Miranda
end.line: Do you not like me, Prince? If that's the case, I'll get over it, but—

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: No, it's not that simple. I just... I've still got things left to do. The battle to unify Thracia has just begun, the Loptr Church and Grannvale Empire are still threats, and North Thracia needs protecting. Right now, I just don't have the time to figure out if I truly love someone or not...

end.speaker: Miranda
end.line: ...... Then I shall return to Ulster to await your answer. But if you don't manage to defeat Travant and South Thracia, consider my offer of marriage withdrawn!

end.speaker: Linoan
end.line: Lord Leif...

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Linoan! Ah... I imagine this must be very bittersweet for you... North Thracia has returned to our rightful hands, but Tarrah remains in Thracia's clutches. You know I'll stop at nothing to recapture the city, so won't you travel with me for a while longer?

end.speaker: Linoan
end.line: Of course I will, Lord Leif!

end.speaker: Deen
end.line: Duchess Linoan, though it pains me to say it, I cannot go with you.

end.speaker: Linoan
end.line: How can that be, Deen? Why can't you?!

end.speaker: Deen
end.line: Thracia is my motherland. North and South shall soon face each other in battle, and I cannot fight against my home. You should stay with the prince, Linoan. He'll protect you from now on.

end.speaker: Linoan
end.line: Deen... How can you say such a thing...? I... I couldn't bear to go on without you.

end.speaker: Deen
end.line: Linoan...?

end.speaker: Linoan
end.line: I will abandon my plans to retake Tarrah if it means you would stay, Dean. So please, remain at my side...

end.speaker: Deen
end.line: Don't say something so stupid, Linoan! This isn't like you at all! Ah, dammit... Now that I think about it, I'd be hurting both Prince Leif and my sworn lord if I left with things the way they are now. I have to avoid that, no matter what it takes...

end.speaker: Mareeta
end.line: Now look here, Little Lady! You've just got to say it! Right now!

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: B-But—

end.speaker: Mareeta
end.line: If you don't say it now, you'll only regret it! Or are you comfortable with staying the "cute little sister" forever?

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: But Mareeta—

end.speaker: Mareeta
end.line: Ugh, you're just going in circles! I'm getting impatient... Hey, Leif!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: What is it, Mareeta? Gah! What's got you looking so... grim?

end.speaker: Mareeta
end.line: Go on, Nanna. You can do it!

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: L-Lord Leif...

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Oh, Nanna! There hasn't been a chance for just the two of us to talk. I wanted to thank you. You've been just as big a help as anyone, and I wanted to make sure you knew how grateful I am.

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: You give me too much credit... I hardly did anything at all.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: I think not! We were raised like siblings, and you've always been there for me, Nanna. You were always there to support me, to comfort me when I needed it, and I wouldn't have fought half as well if I didn't have you to keep my spirits up. When this is all over, I'll go looking for Lachesis—and if I find her, I'll tell her, "I've fallen in love with your daughter, Nanna. I humbly ask for your blessing to wed her."

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: Ah...! Lord Leif...

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: I know we have a long way to go before our battle is over, but I hope you'll stay by my side, Nanna.

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: Of... Of course I will! I'm honored, Lord Leif...

end.speaker: August
end.line: Prince Leif, Lord Seliph is here to see you.

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: It seems my reinforcements were unnecessary. I'm relieved to see you safe, Prince Leif.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Lord Seliph! We're only here because you intervened at Leonster. The credit for this victory is yours.

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: No, North Thracia was liberated by you, Prince, with your own strength—I merely played a momentary role, nothing more. All of North Thracia is agreed on uniting under your rule, it seems. If a country that vast and wealthy were to join the fight against the Empire, my Liberation Army would have cause for celebration. Prince Leif, will you continue to fight alongside me? There's still much left to be done, but if we were to join forces, I know we could overcome any challenge in our way. If you would accept it, I offer you a vow of eternal friendship—to live and die as one, just as our fathers vowed before us.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: I'm honored to accept your oath! After all we've been through, I think of you less as a cousin and more as an older brother. Nothing could make me happier than the idea of pooling our strength to create a brighter future for everyone!

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: Then let us swear it upon this sword! We may have been born apart, but we shall die as one! As your friend, as your sworn brother, we shall join hands and deliver Jugdral from this evil! This I vow to you!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: And I vow just the same to you—an undying oath, and may the stars themselves perish before it is broken!

narration: Thus, Leif's battle, which started in the remote village of Fiana and ended with the liberation of North Thracia, came to a close. Yet although Leif's battle had ended, the war for Jugdral has just begun. In South Thracia, Travant's kingdom has already amassed great power. In the Grannvale Empire, Crown Prince Julius, the Scion of Darkness and incarnation of Loptous, is still alive and well. Now, in year 777 of the Grannvale calendar, the world stands on the brink of a new era...
